info.title: AWS Directory Service
info.description:
AWS Directory Service

This is the AWS Directory Service API Reference. This guide provides detailed information about AWS Directory Service operations, data types, parameters, and errors.

post.description:
AWS Directory Service for Microsoft Active Directory allows you to configure and verify trust relationships.

This action verifies a trust relationship between your Microsoft AD in the AWS cloud and an external domain.

DirectoryId.description: Identifier (ID) of the directory to which to add the address block.

IpRoutes.description: IP address blocks, using CIDR format, of the traffic to route. This is often the IP address block of the DNS server used for your on-premises domain.

UpdateSecurityGroupForDirectoryControlle.description:
If set to true, updates the inbound and outbound rules of the security group that has the description: "AWS created security group for directory ID directory controllers." Following are the new rules:

Inbound:

  • Type: Custom UDP Rule, Protocol: UDP, Range: 88, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: Custom UDP Rule, Protocol: UDP, Range: 123, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: Custom UDP Rule, Protocol: UDP, Range: 138, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: Custom UDP Rule, Protocol: UDP, Range: 389, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: Custom UDP Rule, Protocol: UDP, Range: 464, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: Custom UDP Rule, Protocol: UDP, Range: 445, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: Custom TCP Rule, Protocol: TCP, Range: 88, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: Custom TCP Rule, Protocol: TCP, Range: 135, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: Custom TCP Rule, Protocol: TCP, Range: 445, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: Custom TCP Rule, Protocol: TCP, Range: 464, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: Custom TCP Rule, Protocol: TCP, Range: 636, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: Custom TCP Rule, Protocol: TCP, Range: 1024-65535, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: Custom TCP Rule, Protocol: TCP, Range: 3268-33269, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: DNS (UDP), Protocol: UDP, Range: 53, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: DNS (TCP), Protocol: TCP, Range: 53, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: LDAP, Protocol: TCP, Range: 389, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

  • Type: All ICMP, Protocol: All, Range: N/A, Source: 0.0.0.0/0

Outbound:

  • Type: All traffic, Protocol: All, Range: All, Destination: 0.0.0.0/0

These security rules impact an internal network interface that is not exposed publicly.

ResourceId.description: Identifier (ID) for the directory to which to add the tag.

Tags.description: The tags to be assigned to the Amazon Directory Services directory.

Message.description: The textual message for the exception.

RequestId.description: The identifier of the request that caused the exception.

ComputerAttributes.description: An array of Attribute objects containing the LDAP attributes that belong to the computer account.

Computer.description: Contains information about a computer account in a directory.

RemoteDomainName.description: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the remote domains pointed to by the conditional forwarder.

DnsIpAddrs.description: The IP addresses of the remote DNS server associated with RemoteDomainName. This is the IP address of the DNS server that your conditional forwarder points to.

ReplicationScope.description: The replication scope of the conditional forwarder. The only allowed value is Domain, which will replicate the conditional forwarder to all of the domain controllers for your AWS directory.

ConditionalForwarder.description: Points to a remote domain with which you are setting up a trust relationship. Conditional forwarders are required in order to set up a trust relationship with another domain.

Name.description: The fully-qualified name of the on-premises directory, such as corp.example.com.

ShortName.description: The NetBIOS name of the on-premises directory, such as CORP.

Password.description: The password for the on-premises user account.

Description.description: A textual description for the directory.

ConnectSettings.description: A DirectoryConnectSettings object that contains additional information for the operation.

ConnectDirectoryRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the ConnectDirectory operation.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the new directory.

ConnectDirectoryResult.description: Contains the results of the ConnectDirectory operation.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the directory for which to create the alias.

Alias.description:
The requested alias.

The alias must be unique amongst all aliases in AWS. This operation throws an EntityAlreadyExistsException error if the alias already exists.

CreateAliasRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the CreateAlias operation.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the directory.

CreateAliasResult.description: Contains the results of the CreateAlias operation.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the directory in which to create the computer account.

ComputerName.description: The name of the computer account.

Password.description: A one-time password that is used to join the computer to the directory. You should generate a random, strong password to use for this parameter.

OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedName.description: The fully-qualified distinguished name of the organizational unit to place the computer account in.

ComputerAttributes.description: An array of Attribute objects that contain any LDAP attributes to apply to the computer account.

CreateComputerRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the CreateComputer operation.

Computer.description: A Computer object that represents the computer account.

CreateComputerResult.description: Contains the results for the CreateComputer operation.

DirectoryId.description: The directory ID of the AWS directory for which you are creating the conditional forwarder.

RemoteDomainName.description: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the remote domain with which you will set up a trust relationship.

DnsIpAddrs.description: The IP addresses of the remote DNS server associated with RemoteDomainName.

CreateConditionalForwarderRequest.description: Initiates the creation of a conditional forwarder for your AWS Directory Service for Microsoft Active Directory. Conditional forwarders are required in order to set up a trust relationship with another domain.

CreateConditionalForwarderResult.description: The result of a CreateConditinalForwarder request.

Name.description: The fully qualified name for the directory, such as corp.example.com.

ShortName.description: The short name of the directory, such as CORP.

Password.description: The password for the directory administrator. The directory creation process creates a directory administrator account with the username Administrator and this password.

Description.description: A textual description for the directory.

VpcSettings.description: A DirectoryVpcSettings object that contains additional information for the operation.

CreateDirectoryRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the CreateDirectory operation.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the directory that was created.

CreateDirectoryResult.description: Contains the results of the CreateDirectory operation.

Name.description: The fully qualified domain name for the directory, such as corp.example.com. This name will resolve inside your VPC only. It does not need to be publicly resolvable.

ShortName.description: The NetBIOS name for your domain. A short identifier for your domain, such as CORP. If you don't specify a NetBIOS name, it will default to the first part of your directory DNS. For example, CORP for the directory DNS corp.example.com.

Password.description: The password for the default administrative user named Admin.

Description.description: A textual description for the directory. This label will appear on the AWS console Directory Details page after the directory is created.

CreateMicrosoftADRequest.description: Creates a Microsoft AD in the AWS cloud.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the directory that was created.
The identifier of the directory of which to take a snapshot.

Name.description: The descriptive name to apply to the snapshot.

CreateSnapshotRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the CreateSnapshot operation.

SnapshotId.description: The identifier of the snapshot that was created.

CreateSnapshotResult.description: Contains the results of the CreateSnapshot operation.

DirectoryId.description: The Directory ID of the Microsoft AD in the AWS cloud for which to establish the trust relationship.

RemoteDomainName.description: The Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of the external domain for which to create the trust relationship.

TrustPassword.description: The trust password. The must be the same password that was used when creating the trust relationship on the external domain.

TrustDirection.description: The direction of the trust relationship.

ConditionalForwarderIpAddrs.description: The IP addresses of the remote DNS server associated with RemoteDomainName.

CreateTrustRequest.description:
AWS Directory Service for Microsoft Active Directory allows you to configure trust relationships. For example, you can establish a trust between your Microsoft AD in the AWS cloud, and your existing on-premises Microsoft Active Directory. This would allow you to provide users and groups access to resources in either domain, with a single set of credentials.

This action initiates the creation of the AWS side of a trust relationship between a Microsoft AD in the AWS cloud and an external domain.

TrustId.description: A unique identifier for the trust relationship that was created.

CreateTrustResult.description: The result of a CreateTrust request.

DirectoryId.description: The directory ID for which you are deleting the conditional forwarder.

RemoteDomainName.description: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the remote domain with which you are deleting the conditional forwarder.

DeleteConditionalForwarderResult.description: The result of a DeleteConditionalForwarder request.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the directory to delete.

DeleteDirectoryRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the DeleteDirectory operation.

DirectoryId.description: The directory identifier.

DeleteDirectoryResult.description: Contains the results of the DeleteDirectory operation.

SnapshotId.description: The identifier of the directory snapshot to be deleted.

DeleteSnapshotRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the DeleteSnapshot operation.

SnapshotId.description: The identifier of the directory snapshot that was deleted.

DeleteSnapshotResult.description: Contains the results of the DeleteSnapshot operation.

TrustId.description: The Trust ID of the trust relationship to be deleted.

DeleteAssociatedConditionalForwarder.description: Delete a conditional forwarder as part of a DeleteTrustRequest.

DeleteTrustRequest.description: Deletes the local side of an existing trust relationship between the Microsoft AD in the AWS cloud and the external domain.

TrustId.description: The Trust ID of the trust relationship that was deleted.

DeleteTrustResult.description: The result of a DeleteTrust request.

DirectoryId.description: The Directory ID to remove as a publisher. This directory will no longer send messages to the specified SNS topic.

TopicName.description: The name of the SNS topic from which to remove the directory as a publisher.

DeregisterEventTopicRequest.description: Removes the specified directory as a publisher to the specified SNS topic.

DeregisterEventTopicResult.description: The result of a DeregisterEventTopic request.

DirectoryId.description: The directory ID for which to get the list of associated conditional forwarders.

RemoteDomainNames.description: The fully qualified domain names (FQDN) of the remote domains for which to get the list of associated conditional forwarders. If this member is null, all conditional forwarders are returned.

ConditionalForwarders.description: The list of conditional forwarders that have been created.

DescribeConditionalForwardersResult.description: The result of a DescribeConditionalForwarder request.

DirectoryIds.description:
A list of identifiers of the directories for which to obtain the information. If this member is null, all directories that belong to the current account are returned.

An empty list results in an InvalidParameterException being thrown.

NextToken.description: The DescribeDirectoriesResult.NextToken value from a previous call to DescribeDirectories. Pass null if this is the first call.

Limit.description: The maximum number of items to return. If this value is zero, the maximum number of items is specified by the limitations of the operation.

DescribeDirectoriesRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the DescribeDirectories operation.

DirectoryDescriptions.description:
The list of DirectoryDescription objects that were retrieved.

It is possible that this list contains less than the number of items specified in the Limit member of the request. This occurs if there are less than the requested number of items left to retrieve, or if the limitations of the operation have been exceeded.

NextToken.description: If not null, more results are available. Pass this value for the NextToken parameter in a subsequent call to DescribeDirectories to retrieve the next set of items.

DescribeDirectoriesResult.description: Contains the results of the DescribeDirectories operation.

DirectoryId.description: The Directory ID for which to get the list of associated SNS topics. If this member is null, associations for all Directory IDs are returned.

TopicNames.description:
A list of SNS topic names for which to obtain the information. If this member is null, all associations for the specified Directory ID are returned.

An empty list results in an InvalidParameterException being thrown.

EventTopics.description: A list of SNS topic names that receive status messages from the specified Directory ID.

DescribeEventTopicsResult.description: The result of a DescribeEventTopic request.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the directory for which to retrieve snapshot information.

SnapshotIds.description: A list of identifiers of the snapshots to obtain the information for. If this member is null or empty, all snapshots are returned using the Limit and NextToken members.

NextToken.description: The DescribeSnapshotsResult.NextToken value from a previous call to DescribeSnapshots. Pass null if this is the first call.

Limit.description: The maximum number of objects to return.

DescribeSnapshotsRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the DescribeSnapshots operation.

Snapshots.description:
The list of Snapshot objects that were retrieved.

It is possible that this list contains less than the number of items specified in the Limit member of the request. This occurs if there are less than the requested number of items left to retrieve, or if the limitations of the operation have been exceeded.

NextToken.description: If not null, more results are available. Pass this value in the NextToken member of a subsequent call to DescribeSnapshots.

DescribeSnapshotsResult.description: Contains the results of the DescribeSnapshots operation.

DirectoryId.description: The Directory ID of the AWS directory that is a part of the requested trust relationship.

TrustIds.description:
A list of identifiers of the trust relationships for which to obtain the information. If this member is null, all trust relationships that belong to the current account are returned.

An empty list results in an InvalidParameterException being thrown.

NextToken.description: The DescribeTrustsResult.NextToken value from a previous call to DescribeTrusts. Pass null if this is the first call.

Limit.description: The maximum number of objects to return.

DescribeTrustsRequest.description: Describes the trust relationships for a particular Microsoft AD in the AWS cloud. If no input parameters are are provided, such as directory ID or trust ID, this request describes all the trust relationships.

Trusts.description:
The list of Trust objects that were retrieved.

It is possible that this list contains less than the number of items specified in the Limit member of the request. This occurs if there are less than the requested number of items left to retrieve, or if the limitations of the operation have been exceeded.

NextToken.description: If not null, more results are available. Pass this value for the NextToken parameter in a subsequent call to DescribeTrusts to retrieve the next set of items.

DescribeTrustsResult.description: The result of a DescribeTrust request.

VpcId.description: The identifier of the VPC in which the AD Connector is created.

SubnetIds.description: A list of subnet identifiers in the VPC in which the AD Connector is created.

CustomerDnsIps.description: A list of one or more IP addresses of DNS servers or domain controllers in the on-premises directory.

CustomerUserName.description:
The username of an account in the on-premises directory that is used to connect to the directory. This account must have the following privileges:

  • Read users and groups

  • Create computer objects

  • Join computers to the domain

DirectoryConnectSettings.description: Contains information for the ConnectDirectory operation when an AD Connector directory is being created.

VpcId.description: The identifier of the VPC that the AD Connector is in.

SubnetIds.description: A list of subnet identifiers in the VPC that the AD connector is in.

CustomerUserName.description: The username of the service account in the on-premises directory.

SecurityGroupId.description: The security group identifier for the AD Connector directory.

AvailabilityZones.description: A list of the Availability Zones that the directory is in.

ConnectIps.description: The IP addresses of the AD Connector servers.

DirectoryConnectSettingsDescription.description: Contains information about an AD Connector directory.

DirectoryId.description: The directory identifier.

Name.description: The fully-qualified name of the directory.

ShortName.description: The short name of the directory.

Alias.description: The alias for the directory. If no alias has been created for the directory, the alias is the directory identifier, such as d-XXXXXXXXXX.

AccessUrl.description: The access URL for the directory, such as http://<alias>.awsapps.com. If no alias has been created for the directory, <alias> is the directory identifier, such as d-XXXXXXXXXX.

Description.description: The textual description for the directory.

DnsIpAddrs.description: The IP addresses of the DNS servers for the directory. For a Simple AD or Microsoft AD directory, these are the IP addresses of the Simple AD or Microsoft AD directory servers. For an AD Connector directory, these are the IP addresses of the DNS servers or domain controllers in the on-premises directory to which the AD Connector is connected.

Stage.description: The current stage of the directory.

LaunchTime.description: Specifies when the directory was created.

StageLastUpdatedDateTime.description: The date and time that the stage was last updated.

VpcSettings.description: A DirectoryVpcSettingsDescription object that contains additional information about a directory. This member is only present if the directory is a Simple AD or Managed AD directory.

ConnectSettings.description: A DirectoryConnectSettingsDescription object that contains additional information about an AD Connector directory. This member is only present if the directory is an AD Connector directory.

RadiusSettings.description: A RadiusSettings object that contains information about the RADIUS server configured for this directory.

RadiusStatus.description: The status of the RADIUS MFA server connection.

StageReason.description: Additional information about the directory stage.

SsoEnabled.description: Indicates if single-sign on is enabled for the directory. For more information, see EnableSso and DisableSso.

DirectoryDescription.description: Contains information about an AWS Directory Service directory.

DirectoryLimitExceededException.description: The maximum number of directories in the region has been reached. You can use the GetDirectoryLimits operation to determine your directory limits in the region.

CloudOnlyDirectoriesLimit.description: The maximum number of cloud directories allowed in the region.

CloudOnlyDirectoriesCurrentCount.description: The current number of cloud directories in the region.

CloudOnlyDirectoriesLimitReached.description: Indicates if the cloud directory limit has been reached.

CloudOnlyMicrosoftADLimit.description: The maximum number of Microsoft AD directories allowed in the region.

CloudOnlyMicrosoftADCurrentCount.description: The current number of Microsoft AD directories in the region.

CloudOnlyMicrosoftADLimitReached.description: Indicates if the Microsoft AD directory limit has been reached.

ConnectedDirectoriesLimit.description: The maximum number of connected directories allowed in the region.

ConnectedDirectoriesCurrentCount.description: The current number of connected directories in the region.

ConnectedDirectoriesLimitReached.description: Indicates if the connected directory limit has been reached.

DirectoryLimits.description: Contains directory limit information for a region.

DirectoryUnavailableException.description: The specified directory is unavailable or could not be found.

VpcId.description: The identifier of the VPC in which to create the directory.

SubnetIds.description: The identifiers of the subnets for the directory servers. The two subnets must be in different Availability Zones. AWS Directory Service creates a directory server and a DNS server in each of these subnets.

DirectoryVpcSettings.description: Contains VPC information for the CreateDirectory or CreateMicrosoftAD operation.

VpcId.description: The identifier of the VPC that the directory is in.

SubnetIds.description: The identifiers of the subnets for the directory servers.

SecurityGroupId.description: The security group identifier for the directory. If the directory was created before 8/1/2014, this is the identifier of the directory members security group that was created when the directory was created. If the directory was created after this date, this value is null.

AvailabilityZones.description: The list of Availability Zones that the directory is in.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the directory for which to disable MFA.

DisableRadiusRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the DisableRadius operation.

DisableRadiusResult.description: Contains the results of the DisableRadius operation.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the directory for which to disable single-sign on.

UserName.description:
The username of an alternate account to use to disable single-sign on. This is only used for AD Connector directories. This account must have privileges to remove a service principal name.

If the AD Connector service account does not have privileges to remove a service principal name, you can specify an alternate account with the UserName and Password parameters. These credentials are only used to disable single sign-on and are not stored by the service. The AD Connector service account is not changed.

Password.description: The password of an alternate account to use to disable single-sign on. This is only used for AD Connector directories. For more information, see the UserName parameter.

DisableSsoRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the DisableSso operation.

DisableSsoResult.description: Contains the results of the DisableSso operation.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the directory for which to enable MFA.

RadiusSettings.description: A RadiusSettings object that contains information about the RADIUS server.

EnableRadiusRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the EnableRadius operation.

EnableRadiusResult.description: Contains the results of the EnableRadius operation.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the directory for which to enable single-sign on.

UserName.description:
The username of an alternate account to use to enable single-sign on. This is only used for AD Connector directories. This account must have privileges to add a service principal name.

If the AD Connector service account does not have privileges to add a service principal name, you can specify an alternate account with the UserName and Password parameters. These credentials are only used to enable single sign-on and are not stored by the service. The AD Connector service account is not changed.

Password.description: The password of an alternate account to use to enable single-sign on. This is only used for AD Connector directories. For more information, see the UserName parameter.

EnableSsoRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the EnableSso operation.

EnableSsoResult.description: Contains the results of the EnableSso operation.

EntityDoesNotExistException.description: The specified entity could not be found.

DirectoryId.description: The Directory ID of an AWS Directory Service directory that will publish status messages to an SNS topic.

TopicName.description: The name of an AWS SNS topic the receives status messages from the directory.

TopicArn.description: The SNS topic ARN (Amazon Resource Name).

CreatedDateTime.description: The date and time of when you associated your directory with the SNS topic.

EventTopic.description: Information about SNS topic and AWS Directory Service directory associations.

ExceptionMessage.description: The descriptive message for the exception.

GetDirectoryLimitsRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the GetDirectoryLimits operation.

DirectoryLimits.description: A DirectoryLimits object that contains the directory limits for the current region.

GetDirectoryLimitsResult.description: Contains the results of the GetDirectoryLimits operation.

DirectoryId.description: Contains the identifier of the directory to obtain the limits for.

GetSnapshotLimitsRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the GetSnapshotLimits operation.

SnapshotLimits.description: A SnapshotLimits object that contains the manual snapshot limits for the specified directory.

GetSnapshotLimitsResult.description: Contains the results of the GetSnapshotLimits operation.

InsufficientPermissionsException.description: The account does not have sufficient permission to perform the operation.

InvalidParameterException.description: One or more parameters are not valid.

CidrIp.description: IP address block using CIDR format, for example 10.0.0.0/24. This is often the address block of the DNS server used for your on-premises domain. For a single IP address use a CIDR address block with /32. For example 10.0.0.0/32.

IpRoute.description: IP address block. This is often the address block of the DNS server used for your on-premises domain.

DirectoryId.description: Identifier (ID) of the directory associated with the IP addresses.

IpRouteStatusMsg.description: The status of the IP address block.

AddedDateTime.description: The date and time the address block was added to the directory.

IpRouteInfo.description: Information about one or more IP address blocks.

IpRouteLimitExceededException.description: The maximum allowed number of IP addresses was exceeded. The default limit is 100 IP address blocks.

DirectoryId.description: Identifier (ID) of the directory for which you want to retrieve the IP addresses.

NextToken.description: The ListIpRoutes.NextToken value from a previous call to ListIpRoutes. Pass null if this is the first call.

Limit.description: Maximum number of items to return. If this value is zero, the maximum number of items is specified by the limitations of the operation.

NextToken.description: If not null, more results are available. Pass this value for the NextToken parameter in a subsequent call to ListIpRoutes to retrieve the next set of items.

ResourceId.description: Identifier (ID) of the directory for which you want to retrieve tags.

Tags.description: List of tags returned by the ListTagsForResource operation.

RadiusServers.description: An array of strings that contains the IP addresses of the RADIUS server endpoints, or the IP addresses of your RADIUS server load balancer.

RadiusPort.description: The port that your RADIUS server is using for communications. Your on-premises network must allow inbound traffic over this port from the AWS Directory Service servers.

RadiusTimeout.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to wait for the RADIUS server to respond.

RadiusRetries.description: The maximum number of times that communication with the RADIUS server is attempted.

AuthenticationProtocol.description: The protocol specified for your RADIUS endpoints.

RadiusSettings.description: Contains information about a Remote Authentication Dial In User Service (RADIUS) server.

DirectoryId.description: The Directory ID that will publish status messages to the SNS topic.

TopicName.description: The SNS topic name to which the directory will publish status messages. This SNS topic must be in the same region as the specified Directory ID.

RegisterEventTopicResult.description: The result of a RegisterEventTopic request.

DirectoryId.description: Identifier (ID) of the directory from which you want to remove the IP addresses.

CidrIps.description: IP address blocks that you want to remove.

ResourceId.description: Identifier (ID) of the directory from which to remove the tag.

TagKeys.description: The tag key (name) of the tag to be removed.

SnapshotId.description: The identifier of the snapshot to restore from.

RestoreFromSnapshotRequest.description: An object representing the inputs for the RestoreFromSnapshot operation.

RestoreFromSnapshotResult.description: Contains the results of the RestoreFromSnapshot operation.

ServiceException.description: An exception has occurred in AWS Directory Service.

DirectoryId.description: The directory identifier.

Name.description: The descriptive name of the snapshot.

StartTime.description: The date and time that the snapshot was taken.

SnapshotIds.description: A list of directory snapshot identifiers.

SnapshotLimitExceededException.description: The maximum number of manual snapshots for the directory has been reached. You can use the GetSnapshotLimits operation to determine the snapshot limits for a directory.

ManualSnapshotsLimit.description: The maximum number of manual snapshots allowed.

ManualSnapshotsCurrentCount.description: The current number of manual snapshots of the directory.

ManualSnapshotsLimitReached.description: Indicates if the manual snapshot limit has been reached.

SnapshotLimits.description: Contains manual snapshot limit information for a directory.

Snapshots.description: A list of descriptions of directory snapshots.

Key.description: Required name of the tag. The string value can be Unicode characters and cannot be prefixed with "aws:". The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").

Value.description: The optional value of the tag. The string value can be Unicode characters. The string can contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regex: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").

Tag.description: Metadata assigned to an Amazon Directory Services directory consisting of a key-value pair.

TagLimitExceededException.description: The maximum allowed number of tags was exceeded.

DirectoryId.description: The Directory ID of the AWS directory involved in the trust relationship.

TrustId.description: The unique ID of the trust relationship.

RemoteDomainName.description: The Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of the external domain involved in the trust relationship.

CreatedDateTime.description: The date and time that the trust relationship was created.

LastUpdatedDateTime.description: The date and time that the trust relationship was last updated.

StateLastUpdatedDateTime.description: The date and time that the TrustState was last updated.

Trust.description: Describes a trust relationship between an Microsoft AD in the AWS cloud and an external domain.

DirectoryId.description: The directory ID of the AWS directory for which to update the conditional forwarder.

RemoteDomainName.description: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the remote domain with which you will set up a trust relationship.

DnsIpAddrs.description: The updated IP addresses of the remote DNS server associated with the conditional forwarder.

UpdateConditionalForwarderResult.description: The result of an UpdateConditionalForwarder request.

DirectoryId.description: The identifier of the directory for which to update the RADIUS server information.

RadiusSettings.description: A RadiusSettings object that contains information about the RADIUS server.

UpdateRadiusRequest.description: Contains the inputs for the UpdateRadius operation.

UpdateRadiusResult.description: Contains the results of the UpdateRadius operation.

TrustId.description: The unique Trust ID of the trust relationship to verify.

VerifyTrustRequest.description: Initiates the verification of an existing trust relationship between a Microsoft AD in the AWS cloud and an external domain.

TrustId.description: The unique Trust ID of the trust relationship that was verified.
